intro: Commiphora otjihipana, commonly known as the Namibian myrrh tree, is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree native to the arid regions of Namibia and Angola. It belongs to the Burseraceae family, which includes frankincense and myrrh-producing species. The plant is characterized by its dense, leathery leaves and produces a resinous sap that can be tapped from its bark. This sap is used traditionally for its aromatic and medicinal properties. The plant thrives in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to withstand harsh, semi-arid conditions.
